sub_title: Translator English-Dutch and German-Dutch and copywriter at Lieke Huits vertalingen
summary: Freelance translator English-Dutch and German-Dutch, reviewer and copywriter. I am analytical, eager to learn, accurate and enjoy doing research. My interests are in the field of marketing, technology and modern visual arts. In my free time I like to work out and write short stories, and during the pandemic I started painting and drawing portraits.

I specialize in social media, technology, IT, marketing, corporate wellness and visual arts.

Translated non fiction:
MiniMax Interventionen by Manfred Prior, a small booklet with 15 practical therapeutic interventions, also useful in other areas than psychology and coaching. Dutch title: MiniMax-interventies. Not yet available.

Audioguide Mühle Donsbrüggen (2022) for museum.de

Magazines I participated in as a translator:
Magazine G Geschiedenis, 2010-2011: I translated articles for the editions about Southern Africa, China, Queen Elisabeth and The Celts.

Geopark Magazine, 2020, 2021, 2022. Client: Natur- und Geopark TERRA.vita, Osnabrück. This is a yearly published tourist magazine about the Dutch and German Hondsrug region.

Art Catalogues I participated in as a translator (just a selection):
Catalogue accompanying the exhibition on Norbert Schwontkowski in Gemeentemuseum The Hague, autumn 2020 to spring 2021.

Children's booklet accompanying the exhibition "Cross-border" from 14 October 2018 to 27 January 2019, Draiflessen Collection Mettingen, Germany.

"Fritz Klemm – paintings and works on paper", accompanying the exhibition in Museum de Fundatie Zwolle from 16 June to 2 September 2018.

Room texts for the exhibition "Thorsten Brinkmann. Life is funny, my deer" in GEM Museum for contemporary art The Hague from 31 March to 17 June 2018.

"Hyperrealism: Sculpture", accompanying the exhibition in Kunsthal Rotterdam from 10 March to 1 July 2018.

"Broken Landscapes. Ger Dekkers, Jan Dibbets, Ger van Elk, Jaap van den Ende", accompanying the exhibition in the Stedelijk Museum Schiedam from 18 April to 21 June 2015.
